ratings.comment: Read the reviews and decided to take 213 since I needed it. Lectures are terrible. You can hear breathing/swallowing into the mic, so read textbook. Homework is simple but quizzes and exams are brutal (nothing like the lecture). Can't see your grade all semester and they don't let you see the average grades either. Got an A and wouldn't recommend

Easily the worst professor I've ever had in my life, no one else even compares. Makes the tests so much harder than the quizzes and homework. Usually are given something that you've never seen in class, which is just not how you should be graded. I saw the bad reviews on this teacher and decided to take the risk and hope for the best. I regret it.

Worst professor ever. Would constantly yell at students in Piazza. Would not help at all with questions about the class. The lectures were so long and her accent is so thick. Her exams are literally impossible and she is TERRIBLE at teaching. TAs dont even understand english. Avoid her at ALL costs. I even got an A but regret this class.

Avoid at all costs. Couldn't listen to her lectures because she constantly breathes into the mic, never communicates with students, exams were nothing like any of the examples in her lectures, discussion worksheets, or quizzes. Does not care about her students and TA's are really no help what so ever.
Please dont take a class with this teacher if you can. She doesnt tell you your grade all semester and her lectures are boring. Worst teacher Ive ever had a UW

This class was insane. Spent 10+ hours a week doing homework, and I couldn't understand her lectures at all. They were too fast paced with little examples and in scribbles. She also pretty much refused to answer questions. You have to highly rely on the textbook. Average on the final was a low D, and there were questions on it we weren't taught.

It took 2 months and several ignored emails to finally reschedule any tests. ALL quizzes and exams were for days her class wasn't scheduled to meet. I missed 2 quizzes and a midterm (which I never got to make up!) before she told me my only other option was taking them at 7am the next morning. She made a rough semester so much worse. Thanks 2020.

The online format of the class completely lecture-heavy. She struggles to explain methods and lectures that were prerecorded. Extremely unaccommodating and unhelpful in the form of assistance or rescheduling. TA's have a good understanding of material but also struggle to teach and explain the content. Very frustrating and time consuming class.

Does not care about giving good lectures. Around a quarter attend them. Lectures, homework, and even quiz do not come close to the difficulty of exams. As others said, TA are smart but they are in the Math Dept so not the best teachers. Super low sympathy for anyone struggling or with conflicts. This class is an afterthought for her.

Worst professor I have ever had. Never once have I made a review on this site, but she was so bad I had to comment. She will make constant mistakes during lecture and never even seems prepared. Classic example of a professor who does not understand how to actually teach. Exams are graded subjectively and are significantly different from classwork

Professor Gera's class was the worst ran course I've ever taken. The way things ran was so unorganized. Lecture and work sheets have little to do with what's on the exam. TA's are smart, but are bad teachers and unreliable. I've had to learn everything on my own via Chegg and other online services. If she's your professor, switch to Math 222.
Not the most experienced professor, but ultimately did a good job.

Professor sucks. She has no clue how to write a test. My TA said midterm 1 average was supposed to be 90% but was in the 70s. She doesn't care at all about students by making west coast students wake up at 5am for the final. You know this teacher sucks when my TA says: "I don't understand the purpose of this class." Avoid this teacher at all costs.

If you want tests with material not covered in lectures or homework, no outside help, a teacher who makes mistakes while teaching, and multiple points off for minor mistakes, this is your girl! She is inconsiderate of those who are effected by the pandemic which she makes aware by scheduling tests at 5am and makes tests insanely difficult.

The lectures are so boring, and Prerna has no control over any of her classes. She often makes mistakes during the lectures she is giving, so make sure you're paying attention to correct her. She also takes off a lot of points for minuscule errors, so make sure you show each step of your work. The material is boring, and so are the lectures.

The material wasn't difficult, but the amount of hw and the grading criteria on assignments and exams made no sense. The amount of time you needed to dedicate to hw for the same results felt like running in a rat race. Purposely made final a D average to lower class average. However, she seemed like a genuinely nice person that was trying.

Lectures boring but provide background/proofs for what you apply in the homework. First semester teaching and definitely improved throughout the semester. First two midterms pretty easy. Study hard for final as it is much more difficult and really tests the concepts. I recommend Chegg to do the homework because I did most of them in 2-5 hours.

Tests (especially the final) were impossible, homework took 10+ hours every week to do, extremely repetitive, the lectures were impossible to understand, and no matter how much work I put in to the class, it never showed up in the grades.

Definitely was a new professor. Lectures were boring and she went way too fast. Homework wasn't too hard, but it was tedious and took 8+ hours. Mine was due Mondays while other people had it due Wednesday - whenever your discussion was scheduled. Midterms were fair, but the final was awful. Really liked multiple choice for some reason.

Two midterms were fine, but final was impossible. Homework is easy enough but she assigns so many questions that it takes forever to do (average of 9 hours doing it per week for me). She is hard to understand, unorganized, and writes on the board where you can't see it. I put so much work into this class, but it didn't pay off. DO NOT TAKE!

Quizzes account for too much of the grade, especially when there are only a few in the semester. Homework towards the end of the semester takes 8+ hours, and is extremely repetitive. Frustratingly, it isn't difficult homework, just extremely repetitive and time consuming. The exams are not terrible, but don't slack on the quizzes
Extremely disorganized. Very tough grader. Moves at an incredibly fast pace. Absolutely do not take Math 320 with this professor you will regret it.

First of all, the homework level is too high in the last few weeks of the course. Also, lectures are impossible to follow along in. Only about half the people went. I didn't learn a thing by going. Exams are generally not surprising if you study, though. No keys to anything online. Quite a difficult class. I urge you to take the quizzes seriously.
She gets upset when questions are asked and generally doesnt answer them well. Then she keeps going with he lecture as if we understand it all.

First, she doesnt follow along with the textbook, she skips around and never tells you where in the book the information is coming from. She is hard to understand and gets frustrated when questions are asked. All she shows are examples and doesnt explain anything well. Very difficult to learn from her.
Gets pissed when asked questions.

Every lecture has lower attendance than the previous. Most people are more confused by the end of class than at the start. She skips multiple steps at a time in example problems without explaining it, and if you ask a question she acts confused and disappointed about how you're not understanding everything. Only take her if you have no other choice
